comments:
If the user deletes the last launched config and then attempts F11 or Ctrl-F11 
we log:
org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Launch configuration does not exist.

Problem appears to be as follows:  Somehow, if a config is launched more than once, it lands in the 
'last launched' list more than once, each occurrence pointing to the same config.  Then when the 
config is deleted, only ONE occurrence in the last launched list is deleted, leaving one.  The 
F11/Ctrl-F11 actions retrieve this and try to launch it, but the underlying config is gone.  
Question is, why is the config added twice?

More precisely, this appears to only happen if a config is run in BOTH Run and Debug modes, then 
deleted.  It is added to the last launched list once when it is run, and once when debugged.
